metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1338 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
kernel_crashdump in Apport before 2.19 allows local users to cause a denial of service (disk consumption) or possibly gain privileges via a (1) symlink or (2) hard link attack on /var/crash/vmcore.log.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.19-0ubuntu1
apport-gtk - 2.19-0ubuntu1
apport-kde - 2.19-0ubuntu1
apport-noui - 2.19-0ubuntu1
apport-retrace - 2.19-0ubuntu1
apport-valgrind - 2.19-0ubuntu1
dh-apport - 2.19-0ubuntu1
python-apport - 2.19-0ubuntu1
python-problem-report - 2.19-0ubuntu1
python3-apport - 2.19-0ubuntu1
python3-problem-report - 2.19-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apport package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu1').
